name: The Westin Hotel Europa & Regina, Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the first time for my wife and I to stay at this hotel and visit Venice. I have have traveled a great deal on business in my 30 year career and have a good sense for travel expectations. First , Venice is a wonderful place to visit. Many opportunities to see and enjoy this delightful city. One of the more expensive places I have travel to but for a few days well worth the trip. The Westin Hotel was selected after reading many on line trip reports for many hotels, primaraly for it's location and preceived four star rating. We took a private boat from the airport to the hotel for 90 Euros. There is a desk outside baggage at the airport that you can walk up to and book one for immediate departure to the hotel dock. The trip is about 20 minutes across the open water....
reviews.title: Very Dissappointed in the Europa & Regina

likes.disliked: — Poor Service Attitude of the Staff to resove issues

reviews.title: What a stunning view
reviews.text: Following check in we we taken to our room on the fifth flloor with a "panaramic view" the view consisted of a water view across a side alley to the canal. Not great but OK. I quickly noticed that the room was warm...Was told that the hotel system is old and the room will cool in time. We unpacked and closed the drapes and lightsand went out to view the city.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Returning 4 hours later the room did cool down a bit but was still warm. Since we havd unpacked we dicided to keep the room since the entire hotel is on the same air conditining system and the forced air was very very weak. The room had nice but very old furnishings and the carpet was worn and ripped from wear by the closet. The bath was large but the shower was very small and the water did not drain well creating a pool of water at your feet during use.
reviews.title: Great annivesary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bigist issue we had was using my starwood points to cover the breakfast . For 1500 points would cover breatkast for the cost 104 Euros. We used this system the first day and decided to do the same on day two of our stay. I was told I did not have enought points to cover the second day when I knew I did and after much discussion and my showing the m documentation about my point total they admitted to over charging my starwood account by four times! Not that that was enough when we were checking out they charged me 104 Euros for the second days breakfast on my hotel bill. We did get it corrected but the attitude was one of indifference. As if I was putting them out of their way to correct their billing errors. By the way..if you order a drink be prepared to be charged alot...I oreded a standeded 7 and 7 (wiskey and ginger ale) and was billed 15 euros for the wiskey and another 6 euros for the ginger ale for a total of 21 euros plus a 10 % VAT which is about $35 US dollars....I shouold have ordered wine! Finally, when we were ready to leave I requested a bellman to take our baggage down from the room so we could meet our transportation at the dock. After 15 minutes we decided to do it ourselves since they did not show. This hotel is in a great location to St. Marks Square but I honestly would look at other options for the cost . We enjoyed the city but were very dissappointed in the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a lovely hotel. Had probally the best breakfast have ever had in a hotel in Europe. Its just not easy to find when you go alone and especially with heavy suitcases. So would suggest better signs to the hotel. All in all a great experience.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was completely disappointed with the Westin. I paid with American Express points (120,000 for 2 nights) that were converted to SPG points.
reviews.title: Beware Booking with SPG Points

likes.liked: — The Maintenance of the Room & that wing of the Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were given a room way in the back of the Hotel. The carpet in the Hallways & in the Room was worn out...it had to be at least 30 years old. Grime had settled in at the edges. The walls were dirty, they hadn't seen paint in decades.
reviews.title: Great hotel in an awesome location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Initially, the flat screen Philips TV didn't work. We reported this to the Concierge desk on our way out to sightsee. When we arrived back to our room that evening, it still didn't work. Someone did eventually come and fix it....DURING THE SOCCER GAME!
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, worth it if you can afford it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next morning we were surprised that there was no hot water and we had to take cold showers.
reviews.title: Highlight of our honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We let the front desk know about the problem.
reviews.title: A great option in Venice
It's a Westin. For better or worse.
reviews.text: This hotel is exactly what you'd expect out of a Westin.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location.
reviews.title: Great City Great Hotel and Wonderful Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Beautiful interior.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice rooms.
reviews.title: Great night's keep and breakfast on the grand canal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012
reviews.text: Heavenly bed.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel. Class A service, class A price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008
reviews.text: I found this hotel really beautiful. Lovely public areas with lots of marble and nice furniture. It was also nicely animated (whereas some expensive hotels can seem a bit stuffy and deserted). The restaurant and bar both have wonderful terraces overlooking the Canale Grande. Breakfast is absurdly expensive, but somehow worth it given the selection and quality of the food, and of course the gorgeous setting.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We secured a very good deal via the starwood website so overall I found this to be pretty good value. We booked the basic room category and got a spacious room overlooking the backyard. It was absolutely fine, quiet and well appointed. Good airconditioning and no insects at all. Good turn-down service too. One quibble would be that there were just blankets and no duvet (unlike the usual Westin Heavenly bedding).
reviews.title: Loved the Westin Europa!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: There is a small fitness room, which is a nice facility to have, particularly as space is at such a premium in Venice.
reviews.title: Hard to beat the E&R!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great, just a few steps away from the posh shops, the beautiful St Moise church and San Marco.
reviews.title: A lovely stay

likes.disliked: — The lack of a guide to hotel services in our room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The only criticism I would make concerns the staff. Whilst many of them were friendly and helpful, particularly in the restaurant, a few others at reception/ concierge desk could certainly improve. But then we did not need to rely on them and this did not really impair a wonderful stay in a very charming property.
reviews.title: loved the breakfast terrace

likes.liked: — the service and quality of rooms
likes.disliked: — too expensive for dinner in the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is really beautiful. The staff is courteous but not overly friendly. Our room was very nice and clean, fairly large too. They have a beautiful patio restaurant that is worth having breakfast at for the view. I loved the location - The hotel is right near St. Mark's square.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Hotel and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: This is the hotel of your dreams. Superb decor, superb service and a fabulous location in the magical city of Venice.
reviews.title: Hotel of your Dreams

likes.disliked: — had to traverse a bridge to get to the ferries

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Caution: from the airport get the Venice Card (or order online before you go) for free transport to the hotel instead of the outrageous cost of a private water taxi.
reviews.title: Great location but snobby service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The decor of the rooms is fabulous as was the size of my room overlooking tile roof-tops. The daily service included a bowl of fresh cherries and bottled water compliments of the hotel manager!
reviews.title: Great Hotel with Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The breakfast was 5 star: prosciutto and melon, wild salmon, cheese board, eggs, cappuccino, etc. The service was outstanding from the restaurant.
reviews.title: Not overly impressed

likes.disliked: — The attitude of the staff, most rude and arrogance like I have rarely encountered

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We returned to this hotel after 15 years and we were very disapointed.
reviews.title: Overpriced and very disapointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: 15 years ago, while young and poor, we had there an amazing deal. it was shortly after they reopened and we had the most incredible room.
reviews.title: Air conditioning not sufficient and elevator doesn't work
Great veiw but...
reviews.text: Coming back with friends to Venice after 15 years we naturally booked the same hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The price for a room was €850 and we were looking forward to the same experience.
reviews.title: Grand Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room was a great let-down. narrow and unattractive halls led us to a regular size room with zero decorations. non of the rich wallpaper and art we expected.
reviews.title: Great hotel by the grand canal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: perfectly situated with stunning views, if you can get a canal room, upgrade! it is worth every penny to wake up to a view like this. service was wonderful, i would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: views and location perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I booked this hotel for 2 nights in mid-May using Starwood points. These were the last two remaining award nights during that time period so we felt fortunate that we were able to get these nights. We had read conflicting reviews for the hotel on TA, but, let me tell you, we were nothing but highly satisfied. Even though the hotel is part of a large chain, the hotel itself feels more like a boutique hotel...location is great (right adjacent to St. Mark's Square, but tucked away), service is friendly, from check-in to check-out, management is highly responsive, food is great, and room very comfortable.
reviews.title: Lovely stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we checked in and went to our room, some locksmiths were there changing over the locks on the door. So, we were slightly inconvenienced by having to wait a few minutes to get settled into the room. When we mentioned this in passing to Attilio Dalla Mura, the front desk manager, he was highly apologetic and asked how he could make it right for us. He quite happily treated us to breakfasts for the 2 days of our stay! More than was even warranted.
reviews.title: Magical in every way!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: So, all-in-all, we would strongly recommend this hotel...for the location and the accommodations, but most importantly for the way were treated by Attilio and his staff.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay was above and beyond our expectations! We were met at the airport by a driver who took us to our water taxi - all arranged by the hotel. Our room was ready upon arrival and the front desk clerk accompnaied us up to make sure all was in order. Our terrace overlooking the Grand Canal was huge and well appointed with both a table and chairs for cocktails, etc. and two large comfortable loung chairs for relaxing. Room service, which we used for ice and for breakfast one morning was exceptionally quick and gracious. My only regret is that our stay wasn't longer! Perfetto!
reviews.title: Not meeting my expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We came by ship to Venice and our water transfer to this Hotel started what was going to be a stunning 24hours in Venice. Pulling up outside on the grand canal is pretty special in it's self, but when in step inside you know it's somewhere special. It's dark and moody but has a wonderful oppulance about it too. The staff are pleasant and gracious. One pauses for a moment at the size of the lift, but, after getting to our room, the views from our opening windows was amazing. Everything you see in the postcards comes to life from this area of the Grand Canal.
reviews.title: WOW - the rooms with views are spectacular

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are a good size, bathrooms are lovely and really good showers. A truely nice place to stay - but at the price it would want to be too!
reviews.title: Lovely & Charming but stay away from the concierge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Italian hotels are always a bit of a gamble even if they are 5 stars, but this was a charming hotel & well located. the standard double room was a good size for EU standards. Am a starwood member, so quite used to expecting class & service at a Westin. The electricals were a bit funny - plugging in the phone charger had to be alternated with the table lamps & the room lights some times were temperamental, but all in all it was comfy! we didnt obviously get a great view, but we didnt expect that in a standard room anyway! the best waterfront bar view, though service could be a bit faster - but the staff were lovely & friendly & the drinks pretty strong when they did come! I'd definitely stay there again!
reviews.title: Decent hotel in a GREAT location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My only issue with the hotel was its concierge. Brusque, disinterested and condescending - Not what I expect from a Westin concierge. When asked about 2-3 restaraunts we had been recommended by friends familiar with Venice, he dismissed them ALL outright. Saying Chinese people had taken over the restaraunts..whatever that meant - he insisted on sending us instead to Do Forni in San Marco. He did not even bother with giving us choices, making a reservation without telling us and then insisting we go, since he made the reservation. (smelling a generous commission here?) The restaraunt was the worst we've ever been to. 280 Euro for 2 antipasti, 4 mains and a bottle of wine. the price wouldnt bother us if the food had been edible. the service was rude insisting we order 1st & 2nd course 1 minute after seating us and getting very aggressive about it, they forgot to put in the order for the antipasti, the fish was spoilt and they burnt 1 main and forgot to tell us, bringing it 20 minutes after all the other mains had been finished! Why would the Westin send its guests to such a horrible place? But then again, why does the Westin have a concierge who obviously is disinterested in his job and racist to boot. It spoilt our trip as 3 of us were extremely sick after the meal!
reviews.title: The best bar on the Grand Canal!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I do hope the hotel reads this review and the GM insists that the concierge is banned from recommending Do Forni or that he is given some training in how to behave as is expected from a Westin concierge. The other staff at the hotel seem to know what is expected and perform stellar jobs!
reviews.title: Great location, but expensive

aka: The Westin Hotel Europa And Regina, Venice
description: A picturesque escape on the Grand Canal, The Westin Europa & Regina, Venice faces the beautiful Santa Maria della Salute church. Explore the city from our canal-side location: the famous monuments of Piazza San Marco, shopping, and the incomparable poetry of Venice are steps away. Guestrooms and suites, many renovated and some with large terraces, offer city or water views and contemporary conveniences.
